meanings.definition: Solve (a problem, puzzle, or difficult situation) beforehand.
meanings.sent1: She presolved the math problem before the teacher even assigned it.
meanings.sent2: He always presolves the crossword puzzles in the newspaper.
meanings.sent3: The detective presolved the case so quickly that everyone was amazed.
meanings.sent4: By presolving the issue, she avoided a lot of unnecessary stress.
meanings.sent5: Presolving problems can save a lot of time and effort in the long run.

meanings.sent1: The presolved puzzle was waiting for him on the table.
meanings.sent2: She was impressed by his presolved strategy for the game.
meanings.sent3: The presolved mystery left everyone wondering how he did it.
meanings.sent4: The presolved equation made the math test much easier.
meanings.sent5: The presolved plan worked perfectly without any hiccups.
